result.execSummary:
The defendant David L. MOON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Provide DNA sample.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with any known drug users/dealers.  

Comply with any other assessment.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 11-10-15 at 10:30 a.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-17-15 at 2:45 p.m.   Plea Date is set for 11-10-15 at 10:30 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.
Matthew Kolell through Public Defender.
RE:  Bail jumping, on 05-31-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony and misdemeanor bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-22-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
